Key Match Events: The Lakers secured a dramatic 104-99 victory thanks to their defense in the clutch.
Davis dominated the paint and Dalton Knecht found his range in an electrifying third quarter.
The Pelicans struggled with turnovers, and the Lakers capitalized and finished the quarter up 75-71.
Pre-Game Insights: The Lakers entered the game on a four-game win streak, while the injury-riddled Pelicans aimed to start a winning streak of their own.
Two teams forever connected by the Anthony Davis trade clashed in Saturdayâ€™s LA Lakers vs New Orleans Pelicans matchup at the Smoothie King Center in Louisiana.
Post-Match Reflections: With the Pelicans down three with seconds left, the LA defense forced a turnover and Knecht made two free throws to seal the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was a back-and-forth affair, with both teams battling for control in the first quarter.
The Pelicans gained momentum with solid contributions from Ingram and rookie Yves Missi.
A late 3-pointer from Jeremiah Robinson-Earl gave the Pelicans a 56-46 advantage as the quarter ended.
Others: The Pelicans were without key players like Zion Williamson, Jordan Hawkins, Dejounte Murray, CJ McCollum, and Herbert Jones.
The Lakers were led by Anthony Davis with 31 points and 14 rebounds, while Dalton Knecht had 27 points, seven rebounds, and five 3-pointers as a starter.
The Pelicans were led by Brandon Ingram with 32 points to lead the team.
